subject: Sales
title: Priming: The Hidden Persuader
description: A short lesson to help you apply Priming: The Hidden Persuader.

hook.text: Show someone the word 'yellow' and they recognize 'banana' faster. The first word primes the brain.

buildup.text: Priming means one stimulus quietly influences the response to the next one.

discovery.text: Stores use scent priming. Fresh bread smell near a cafe entrance boosts food sales significantly.

twist.text: Priming is mostly unconscious. People don't realize a smell or word steered their decision.

climax.text: In sales, prime buyers with positive imagery and language before you make the offer.

punchline.text: What they see first shapes what they choose next.

quiz.question: What is priming in psychology?
options: One stimulus unconsciously influencing the next response
